summary: USAID spent about $1.4 billion in fiscal year 2016 on international food aid projects under the Food for Peace Act. These funds have traditionally been used to buy food in the United States and transport it abroad. In addition, USAID also spends some of this money on implementation and support costs, such as storing food in warehouses and—in recent years—providing cash and food vouchers to...
title: International Food Assistance: USAID Has Controls for Implementation and Support Costs but Should Strengthen Financial Oversight
